reviews.advice: Introducing complimentary meals or refreshments could further enhance the workplace environment.
reviews.cons: I haven’t experienced any downsides here. It’s a great place to work.
reviews.pros: eBay offers a great work-life balance, with wonderful people to collaborate with. The leaders are knowledgeable, supportive, and truly understanding. They give you the space and encouragement to grow, both personally and professionally. It feels like a second home, and I genuinely love being part of the eBay family.

reviews.cons: Not much to say about this
reviews.pros: Very nice culture and people

reviews.advice: Stop pretending you have a soul.
reviews.cons: Will buy up your job just to liquidate the place ASAP. Has active disdain for employees and will only consider your professional input if it already aligns with how they think they will make money even when they are objectively shooting themselves in the foot. Isn't afraid to unnecessarily pile aggresive security guards into a place of work when they screw over loyal employees. Think company culture is made by administration who only participate in it during Town Halls and holiday parties rather than the people who actually participate in it daily. Their payroll is awful and makes mistakes regularly and will not rush to rectify the issue, your bills and livelihood be damned. They think of their employees as inherently replaceable and the neighborhoods they operate in as pools to sap taxpayer money from and will leave at the drop of a hat. Did I mention that they'd rather spend millions of dollars to flee from a Union trying to force them to give their employees a living wage? Will setup cameras to track your every movement. Seriously, if you find yourself in the unfortunate position of your job being purchased by Ebay, start looking for new work ASAP.
reviews.pros: Never had a problem with their insurance myself.

reviews.advice: Stand up for your employees and have compassion and empathy for them. You preach empathy but show none.
reviews.cons: The metrics are horrible. Especially Resolution. They want you to resolve every call but the kicker is that you cannot because of policies. Agents receive a survey which is then used on their metrics which puts agents on plans then fired if not improved. If agent receives a no on the survey for resolving the customers issue the agent suffers immensely. Policies prevent agents from resolving many issues. Customer blame the company for not receiving their item when the company/agent has no control over the sellers actions or the carrier. eBay needs to change the survey because sellers and buyers use it to complain about the company and the agents suffer on their metrics because of it. The year I left we had 7 people quit on our team in one quarter because of this mess. They will also put more work on you without increasing pay. eBay policies are massive and while they make sense, employees should not suffer because of them on their surveys that count as 60% of the agents metrics.
reviews.pros: Health Benefits are excellent. Free swag.

reviews.advice: Patience and more guidance, thank you.
reviews.cons: Need more accessible entry to the building besides the dock door part. There’s a main door on the opposite side of the building which looks perfect for everyone to park.
reviews.pros:
Great experience, you’ll be learning cards, you get to see the artwork and foiling types. Not only you learn cards, but you gain knowledge to further your career out of it, if you exceed in the position you’re currently at you’ll gain access to further your knowledge like me! I’m a Roca Operator. I work on Roca Machines! They sort cards together in a tray, placing them separately at first bin by bin, it’s fun to look at through the monitor where you can view the inside while it’s performing.
They have awesome benefits as well! Overall, the people are great, you’ll make friends and there’s free snacks everyday, but on top of that free food every other day for 3 days! Mmm
reviews.summary: TCG Player is the best thing EBay has took over!

reviews.cons: They charge sellers too much in fees.
reviews.pros: Love it here, everyone's nice

reviews.cons:
Some team leads have a power trip and seems nice but secretly plotting to fire you.
You switch teams leads about 4 times a year
reviews.pros:
benefits start day 1
Family Oriented company 
Pay is top tier
reviews.summary: Best Company I’ve ever worked for

reviews.advice: Dedicated career development plans for employees to help with growth
reviews.cons:
Lack of transparency on upward mobility, needs improvement
Goals change often leads to constant re-prioritization and ambiguity
Lots of silos in the org
reviews.pros:
Great organization and people, culture is positive mostly
Marketing org leadership is knowledgeable and approachable
Nice benefits and stock plans

reviews.cons: irate customers, unrealistic metric system, unprofessional leadership,
reviews.pros: benefits, tuition reimbursement, remote, advancement opportunities

reviews.cons: Too much company politics in the play. Some teams are super busy but does not get enough compensations -> leading to attrition.
reviews.pros: If you are in a right team, you will have awesome WLB. Also, have seen a lot of engineers just cruising. Now I left, I realized that eBay pays well generally, but not like FAANG well.
reviews.summary: Team dependent but generally good work

reviews.cons: Growth can be a challenge in some teams
reviews.pros: Work life balance is nice

reviews.cons: Value time spent on call over customer experience, have a large number of things that need to be sent to IT or back office and you rarely hear back in the expected timeframe. IT also doesn't communicate with members at all CSR's are expected to follow up with members to resolve issues after hearing back from IT which leads to negative experiences when you have to go back to IT or the member is more technically inclined and needs to get the issue resolved ASAP.
reviews.pros: Great benefits, pay is good, teammates and management actually help each other

reviews.cons:
Lack of documentation within teams.
Not discoverability of cross team/org projects/efforts.
reviews.pros:
Good team members. Lot of relevant work.
Fast paced.

reviews.cons: Slow Moving but improving that aspect now
reviews.pros: Great People to work with. eBay is now improving and has an excellent future ahead.

reviews.advice: Listen to seller more than the buyers
reviews.cons: Traffic to page can be bad
reviews.pros: Work from home and great hours

reviews.advice: Less hierarchy, encourage more  bottoms up contribution
reviews.cons: Depending on the office location, sometimes people are not the smartest. I've encountered senior or staff level engineers who cannot solve problems that they'd be expected to at the level. Planning cycle is hell and really pointless. Company is really large so there are often duplicate projects or people working on overlapping things.
reviews.pros: I am in an org that is relatively product led, with great product leadership (from twitter, meta,etc). I get to work on products that are really interesting. The people are super kind and work life balance is great.
reviews.summary: Good PM experience depending on the org

reviews.advice: Define clear priorities and say no to more, focus on quality and not quantity,  appreciate and take care of employees. Put customer experience over profits (its how you'll stay relevant and provide value for them so they stay customers, you can make profits without customers.
reviews.cons: Overworked, unreasonable deadlines,  lack of structure, lack of focus on priorities,  and lot of firefighting or just hurry up and do.
reviews.pros: Pay, some benefits, flexible remote and in office
reviews.summary: Lost care for customer and employee

reviews.advice: Check in with employees annually and offer more incentives through Human Resources.
reviews.cons:
Inconsistent income 
Heavily taxed 
Lots of paperwork and upkeep 
Requires sonstant research for what items are trending and selling
reviews.pros:
Freedom to choose schedule
Work from home
Be your own boss
Very user friendly interface 
Discounts on shipping

reviews.cons: Reorgs all the time. I averaged about one every 6 months. I guess that's what happens at a dinosaur of a company. Constant confusion on who's doing what, oftentimes with teams you've never heard of apparently doing the same thing (or trying to). Frequent directional changes, and in recent years mass layoffs.
reviews.pros: A digestible environment to be in. Unlike some other companies I've worked at, this was very much chill compared to some of the dog-eat-dog worlds I've been in. People felt like they were working together with you hand-in-hand, and you could create genuine bonds and relationships with those around you.

reviews.advice: Have faith in the workers who do the nitty gritty everyday. They are the ones who know and understand the business better than anyone. Give them opportunities to succeed.
reviews.cons: There is no room for growth at all, especially outside of the Authenticity Guarantee program. Employees will apply for positions outside of the program and not receive them, when they are basically doing the job at hand. They talk about “hiring from within” and still continue to hire outside of the company - people who don’t even understand authentication and the operations. It puts a strain on the operation and those who are in it everyday. There is a disconnect between departments, too many hands in every pot so nothing gets done, ever. After sneaker con was acquired, they should have re-interviewed each person who was coming over, especially in management. In an operation, if someone isn’t working, let them go. Enough of the 50 million chances when they are not doing their job correctly.  eBay could be the best in this realm of work, but they continue to shoot themselves in the foot.
reviews.pros: Great company to work for, especially within the Authentication department. Co-workers are passionate about what they do and the talent is unmatched. You learn a lot from a big corporate company and there are a ton of opportunities to meet and learn from people from all over.
reviews.summary: Great company to work for but no growth.
